result.execSummary:
All charges against Bruce S Jones in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bruce S Jones is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce S Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,826.10 entered as ordered by the court on 04/15/16 to pay $60.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/03/18. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Order and Affidavit for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.  Signed, filed and distributed.

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case is set for jury trial.  Defense ready to proceed.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is GRANTED by the Court without prejudice.  Defendant released from conditions of bail and any bail on deposit to be returned to the poster.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Shatoya J. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191207 in court 1x on 1/25/16.
Notice of Alibi, received and filed.
Witness fee request prepared for Shatoya J. was approved for 1 appearance on 1/25/16 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Shatoya J. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Order Appointing Investigator, received and filed.

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. State if prepared to proceed with trial today. Defense counsel is missing some photos from discovery and requests an adjournment. State does not object. Court orders photos to be turned over by 1/28/2016.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 45.  All parties are notified that effective January 30, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackermann-Havas, Branch 45,  in Room 504 Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case had been passed from this morning.  The defense provided information to the state as to  defendant's employment on the alleged offense date.  The state will contact human resources and conduct further investigation. Defense is requesting a new trial date.  Case is adjourned to 1-25-2016 for jury.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains in trial posture for 10-28-2015.

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 10-7-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-28-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
sign and filed.   mld

Off the record.  Court appoints Attorney Ramon Valdez who was present and agreed to accept case.  Court orders Attorney Valdez to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.    mld

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court appoints Attorney * subject to her/his accepting the case.  Court orders Attorney * to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case.   Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SJ dob 2/12/88

Defendant Bruce S Jones in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Bruce S Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
